column1: good length, starts outside off, Mustafiz finds a hint of away swing, no shot from Elgar
Mustafiz shortens his length and ventures wider outside off - finishes wider than a set of stumps outside off - Elgar isn't tempted
pitched up and much closer to off stump, but not close enough to draw a stroke from Elgar
floated full on a sixth-stump line outside off, no lateral movement, Elgar ushers it through to Liton behind the stumps
back of a length and slanted in from outside off, but does not threaten the off stump, Elgar carefully covers his off stump and lets it go
Mustafiz probes away in the channel, Elgar is happy to shoulder arms. That caps an over of leaves
pitched up and rolls through outside off, knee-high take for the keeper
better carry for the keeper. Good length and holds its line in the channel, ignored
good length and nibbles in a touch on off, there's bat on ball. Markram hangs back and defends it to cover
good length and angled in at off stump, Markram presses forward and tightly blocks it back to Shafiul
back of a length and holds its line on off, Markaram responds with a jabbing punch to cover
pretty full and angling in towards off stump, Markaram closes the face and drives the ball straight to mid-on
very full and angling in on middle, Elgar leans into it and drives it handsomely through the gap at midwicket
full and angling away outside off, Markaram presses forward and defensively pushes it to the cover region
back of a length and slanting away with the angle outside off, Markram ignores it in the channel
nice and full again, angling away outside off, Markram tucks his bat inside the line and lets it pass
back of a length and outside off, Markram pats it wide of cover and gets off the mark in Test cricket after 10 balls
good length and nibbles in on off, 133.7ks, Elgar opens the face and defensively guides the ball to cover
crackling inswinging yorker, finishes on off stump, Markram jabs his bat down hastily
full and on a fourth-stump line, Markram lets it pass
good length and angled in on off stump, Markram covers up the line and blocks it back down the pitch
back of a length and heading towards the top of off stump, Markram stops it in its tracks
wide of the crease, full and straying into the pads, Markram punishes Shafiul. Stretches forward and flicks it crisply between midwicket and mid-on. Easy on the eye...
hip-high short ball on the off stump, 133ks, Markram is far too early into a pull and cops a glancing blow on his body
back of a length and straight in line as Elgar punches it away to mid-on. The ball bursts through the fielder's hands
full and angling away around off, Markram's head is right over the ball as he blocks to cover
even fuller and angling away in the channel, no lateral movement in the air or off the surface. Mustafiz undercuts the ball. Left alone
half-volley outside off. That's a gift to Markram with a label: 'welcome to Test cricket'. Markram tears open the wrapper and creams a drive off the front foot. Stroked through the covers
tighter on a fourth-stump line, defended in front of cover
back of a length and slanting away outside off, and that's punchily blocked to cover
floated up outside off, and slides back in, ignored
pushed through on the off stump, no turn, Elgar defends it watchfully off the front foot
loopier and outside off, Elgar opens the face and runs it gently past the left of slip
Elgar presses forward and taps a full ball from a fourth-stump line to short cover
non-turning length ball just a shade outside off, pressed to short cover off the front foot again
shorter and slides into off stump, clipped off the back foot to the left of mid-on
on a good length and outside off, Elgar hoists his bat above his shoulder and lets it go
just short of a good length and angling in on middle and leg, Elgar stands up tall and punches the ball down to mid-on
Mustafiz ventures a bouncer, it sails over middle stump as Elgar ducks under it without any fuss
back of a length and attached with width outside off, Elgar doesn't really get on top of the bounce. He winds up jabbing the ball away to point
banged in short on middle, skiddy delivery at 138.2ks, Mustafiz leaves Elgar in a tangle. Awkwardly fended off the chest to the leg side
back of a length and angling away outside off, Markram drops it defensively to cover
delightful drive from Elgar. He forays down the track, gets right to the pitch, and drives it between mid-off and cover
dangled up outside off, tapped to cover
length-ball slider outside off, nearly 94ks, blocked
round-arm fizzer, good variation from Mehidy, hastily defended
tossed up full on middle, driven back to the bowler, who can't collect it cleanly. He deflects the ball down to long-off
shorter and outside off, Elgar negotiates off the back foot
hurled in short, chest-hunting delivery, Markram rises with it, rides the bounce, and works it deftly through square leg
short of a length and slanted in at the top of off stump, Elgar shuffles across off stump and turns the ball to midwicket
not as short as the previous ball. Back of a length and angled in on middle stump, and that's pushed away to mid-on
Mustafiz sends down another lifter, tennis-ball bounce, Elgar evades it
Mustafiz bowls a full one into the pads, Elgar gleefully picks it off to long leg
very full and angling away outside off, no shot
floated up on off stump, length ball, dropped to the off side off the back foot
tossed up on off stump again, no turn with the new-ish ball, Elgar dances down the track and drives it to the right of mid-on
shorter, flatter, sits up outside off, Elgar jabs away from the body. Hit back to the bowler
skiddy ball on the off stump, whipped away to mid-on
Elgar presses forward, meets this length ball outside off with an open face and glides the ball to point
flatter and shorter outside off - these short balls are sitting up, Elgar has ample time to punch a single down to long-off
full and angling away on a sixth-stump line, Elgar presses forward and shoulders arms
back of a length and on the hips, Elgar plays a long way in front of his body and winds up jabbing the ball away to the square-leg region
back of a length and slanting away just a shade outside off, Elgar opens the face and dabs the ball square through the off side
short and holds its line outside off, Elgar forces the ball to point off the back foot
Taskin bangs a bouncer on middle, Elgar watches it all along before ducking under it
sliding into the pads, turned with the wrists to the man at deep midwicket
fired short and outside off, cut off the back foot to the cover
back of a length and outside off, Elgar shifts back again, this time punches to the right of cover
low full-toss on middle stump, which is driven serenely to long-on
sliding into the pads from around the wicket, nurdled away past the left of midwicket
short offbreak, finishes on off, but the length allows Markram to punch it to long-on off the back foot
Mehedi tosses it on the pads and watches Elgar tuck a single around the corner
short of a length and angling in on top of off stump, Elgar hops and fends it off to short leg
on a length and sliding in on middle stump, Elgar yanks his bottom hand off the bat and splices a drive to the left of the bowler
wide of the crease and straying into the pads, easily glanced to long leg
nip-backer, finishes on off from a back of a length, skewed to mid-on off the inside half
short and wide outside off, from over the wicket, Elgar jumps off the ground and square-cuts it away past the left of backward point. Can't bowl this line and length on this pitch
full and straight, Markram shuffles across and plays a nifty little flick through the vacant spaces at square leg
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, Markram presses forward and taps it to cover
and Markram silences them with a picture-perfect drive. Slightly overpitched and outside off, he leans into it and sends the ball skimming between covers and mid-off
just short of a good length on off, punchily driven to mid-off
back of a length and a bit too close to Markram for a cut. He inside-edges it past the stumps as the ball rolls away fine on the leg side
full and rolls through outside off, ignored
back of a length on off, Markram stands tall and punches it away to the left of mid-on
just short of a good length and outside off, guided square to the off side
short and angling away wide outside off - wider than a set of stumps outside off - no shot
good length on middle, forward and pressed back to the bowler
short and straying into the hips - wayward lines from Taskin - simply tickled away fine to the right of Liton
just short of a good length and angling away outside off, solidly punched out to cover

second slip had just moved to leg slip and Elgar runs a controlled outside edge through now-vacant second slip. Pitched up and angling away outside off from over the wicket, the opener plays with soft hands and finds the gap
back of a length and outside off, Markram forces a single to deep cover off the back foot
full and angling in on middle from around the wicket, Elgar moves forward and drives the ball to short midwicket, where Sabbir throws himself to his right to intercept the ball
back of a length and angled in straight, Elgar stands up tall and punches the ball down to mid-on
just short of a good length and straightens away outside off, draws a loose waft from Elgar and goes past the outside edge
tucked off the hips to deep midwicket
on a length and outside off, Elgar opens the face and runs the ball to gully
back of a length and holds its line outside off, ignored
back of a length and on a fifth-stump line outside off, Markram shoulders arms again
shorter than the previous two balls, the line is outside off, quelled to cover
floated full on a sixth-seven-stump line outside off, Markram, standing on off, judges it well and lets it go
very full and angling in on middle, Markram presses forward, controls a drive past midwicket. Terrific timing and placement to boot
shorter and outside off, a jabbing punch to short cover ensues
full and angling in on from around the wicket, Elgar inches forward and pats it to short midwicket
full and straight, closes the face and drives it sweetly to the left of mid-on. Elgar's driving has been delightful this morning
short and sits up outside off, stands up tall and forces the ball to short cover, where the fielder (Mominul) fumbles and allows a single when it should have been a dot
back of a length and outside off, Markram leans into a drive and sends it to the right of deep point
back of a length and slanted in  on off, punched back to the left of Shafiul
back of a length and angling in on off, clipped away to midwicket off the back foot
good length on middle and leg, Markram moves forward and drives the ball to short midwicket

Markram lets his hands wander away from hid body. He punches on the up but the ball does not carry to Mustafiz at backward point. Back of a length and outside off, loose shot from the debutant. The ball just bounced in front of Mustafiz
length ball on off, played back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Markram rises on top of the bounce and solidly punches to cover
full tempter outside off, Markram isn't tempted
back of a length and angling in on middle, quietly played down to mid-on
pitched up and outside off, Elgar rocks forward and drives it to the right of mid-off
back of a length, angling, and straightens away outside off. Elgar loosens his grip and taps it to cover
tight line on off, defended off the front foot
nice and full just a shade outside off, push-driven to mid-off
good length and angling in on off, dabbed to mid-on
neatly tucked off the pads to deep square leg
slides in from around the wicket, takes the inside edge and wanders away to square leg
tossed up on middle, played back to the bowler
flatter and drifts in on middle, tapped down to wide long-on
back of a length and breaks in on middle, back-foot punch to long-on
short and darted in on middle, clipped to deep square leg off the back foot
shorter and outside off, leans back and cracks it away to the left of sweeper cover
tossed on middle, blocked to silly point off the front foot
Elgar opens the face and guides a full ball from outside off to cover
drifting down leg, tickled away to fine leg for three
skids on outside off, punched down to long-on off the back foot
full on middle, tapped back to the bowler off the front foot
very full on middle and leg, driven to the leg side
just short of a good length and angling away outside off, placed in the gap at cover
back of a length, defended on of stump
short and angling away outside off, crashed straight to point
picked off the hips to long leg
back of a length and outside off, run away to point
tight line on off, blocked to cover
sliding offbreak outside off, punched down to long-on
floated up on middle, defended with soft hands to silly point off the front foot
length ball, angled in on middle, played back to Mehidy
tossed up on middle, bunted calmly to long-off. Elgar opens SA's home summer with a solid fifty - his ninth in Test cricket
full and outside off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot

A mix-up between the wickets but Markram turns back and undoes his steps. Looped up and outside off, Markram presses forward and drives it against the break to cover, where the fielder fumbles. Elgar decides not to risk a run off the misfield. Markram stops near the middle of the pitch, then scampers back
back of a length and outside off, patted to the off side

very full on off, drilled ram-rod straight down the ground, Mushfiq, the captain, chases the ball, slides near the edge of the boundary and swats the ball back into the field of play. Great commitment from the Bangladesh captain
back of a length and outside off, steered off the face to deep point
Mustafiz bangs a bouncer on middle, tennis-ball bounce for Mustafiz, Elgar slips under it
Elgar rises on top of a short ball outside off and punches nicely in the gap at cover
sharper bouncer outside off, Fizz finds some fizz off the deck as the ball flies through to Liton. Elgar arches his back and lets it go
flighted on middle, solidly defended in front of short mid-on
tossed on off stump, blocked off the front foot
slower offbreak on off, just a hint of turn, forward and smothered
pushed through on off, defended back to the bowler
non-turning full ball on off, eased down to long-on
looped up outside off, no turn again, driven through the line to cover
back of a length and angled in on off, driven with the bottom hand to mid-on
wide of the crease, half-volley outside off, Markram lays into a cover drive. Fetch that!
back of a length and angled down leg, past the flick, good take from Liton diving to his left
short ball outside off, Mustafiz had rolled his fingers across it, Markram waits for the ball to arrive. Rides the bounce and pulls it behind square
banged in short and aimed at the chest, Elgar rides the bounce and fends it to leg
back of a length and on middle, Markram replies with a dead-bat defence
back of a length and angling away outside off, Elgar shovels it to midwicket
very full and angling across off stump, nothing doing from Elgar
back of a length and straightens on off stump, Elgar runs the ball to the off side
back of a length and slanting away on a fourth-stump line, Elgar camps back and forces the ball to extra cover
really full and well wider than a set of stumps outside off, no shot
length ball on off stump, Elgar hangs back and pokes it out square on the off side
tossed-up offbreak, worked with the spin to square leg
looped up on off stump, Markram ventures forward and across in defence
First century opening stand in 18 Test innings for SA. Faf applauds from the change room. Nudged with the break behind square on the leg side
shorter and outside off, chopped to backward point. They take on Taskin's arm and scamper across for a single
starts just outside off and spins into the right hander, full, bunted to midwicket
skiddy offbreak, punched with the spin to mid-on
good length and skidding into off stump, Markram's defensive technique has been rock solid
very full on off stump, Markram presses forward and punchily drives it straight down the ground. Placed to the right of mid-off
Fifty on Test debut for Markram! Really full and outside off, he leans into another drive, this caressed to the right of the sweeper on the off side
full and floated very wide outside off, Markram shoulders arms
Markram unfurls another delectable drive. Pitched up on middle, check-driven to the left of mid-on now
good length and slanted in on off, calmly pushed down to mid-off
tossed just a shade outside off, Elgar gets forward and drives it to the right of short extra cover
round-arm slider on off, chopped away more or less straight to that fielder now
full on off, another front-foot drive to short extra cover
guided off the off stump to backward point
length ball on off, pushed to the off side, short extra cover being kept busy by Elgar
floated up just a shade outside off, defensively pushed to short extra cover yet again
good length on off, driven with the incoming angle to mid-on
length ball hung up really wide outside off, Markram does not bite
full and just a shade outside off, the bat-face turns on impact as Markram presses forward and skews a drive to mid-on
hip-high short ball on middle, Markram misjudges the bounce. He attempts a pull, the ball strikes the hip, and floats to the keeper. The caught-behind appeal is shot down
full and stays low on off, Markram stoops low and deals with it. Variable bounce on the first day. Well, well...
tight line on off, tighter defence from Markram off the front foot
tossed up liberally outside off, smoothly drive through the line to long-off
dipping offbreak on off, defended off the front foot
follows the offbreak with a fast slider outside off, left alone
full offbreak, finishes on middle, defended with the turn to short leg
pushed through on off stump, tapped away to mid-on
Markram bends forward to smother this full offbreak on off
banged in short and outside off, Elgar is early into a pull. He miscues the ball beside his feet
length ball on off stump, Elgar plays it back down the pitch
dug in short on the leg stump, Elgar lines it up and strongly pulls it off the back foot. Placed it between deep square leg and deep fine leg
fullish and holds its line outside off, ignored in the channel
floated full on off stump, bunted down to mid-on
length ball on off stump, angled down to gully with soft hands
lobbed up on off stump, blocked off the front foot
Markram gallops down the track, mid-on is up, the bowler slows it up, and keeps him to a quiet defence
slower offbreak on off, blocked off the front foot again
tossed up higher on off stump, overpitched, Markram extends his hands and beautifully lofts it over the bowler's head. Superb shot selection
dropped short and wide outside off, chopped to point
sliding into the pads, firmly whipped away to the midwicket boundary
full on off, Elgar plays it back down the pitch
nice and full outside off, leans into a drive and creams it to cover
just short of a good length and outside off, Elgar jabs it away to extra cover
floated up on a sixth-stump line, eased to mid-off
Elgar thought about having a crack at this full one outside off before tucking his bat inside the line and letting it go
back of a length on off stump, Elgar shuffles across and turns it to mid-on
slower offbreak on off, blocked to the right of short leg
blocked behind square off the back foot
driven with the break to long-on. Lovely flow of the arms
back of a length on middle, flicked away off the back foot between square leg and midwicket
length-ball offbreak, defended off the back foot
pushed through on off stump, Markram covers up in defence
on a length and swerves away - hint of reverse - outside off, no shot
just short of a good length and outside off, back-foot force to mid-off
really full and outside off, Elgar is on the walk as he drives it back to Shafiul
pitched up and reverses away outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, sweetly punched to extra cover
floated full and outside off, ignored
tossed-up offbreak on off, pushed to the right of short mid-on
flatter and wide outside off, chopped away to backward point
tossed up on middle, driven with the turn to midwicket
dangled up on off, bunted to the left of short mid-on now
flat on middle, jabbed away to the left of midwicket
short of a length and outside off, Elgar gets on top of the bounce and punches to sweeper
back of a length and outside off, stays low, Markram thrusts his hands at a cut. Bottom-edges it behind to the left of the keeper
floats through outside off, variable bounce again, ignored
Shafiul goes wide of the crease but this length ball holds its line outside off, left alone
dug short and wide outside off, Markram scythes a cut to deep point
full tempter outside off, Elgar does not go after it
tossed-up offbreak on middle, defended
skids on outside off, late-cut away behind point
tossed up on middle, blocked back down the pitch to the left of the bowler
shorter, slower outside off, defended off the back foot to silly point
loopier and fuller outside off, driven through the line to cover

flighted on the leg stump, Elgar knows there is no protection at midwicket. He stretches out and sweeps it over the boundary. It goes all the way for a six - not sure he intended to clear the boundary
short and wide outside off, Markram carves a cut to the right of sweeper
pitched up and outside off, Elgar rocks forward and hits it to mid-off
length ball on off, chopped in front of point for one
just short of a good length and outside off, sliced away square through the off side
picked off the pads to deep midwicket

slider on middle, punched off the back foot to the right of mid-on
straight ball on middle, blocked to the leg side
straighter one on off, grazes the outside edge, and rolls behind square on the off side
tossed on middle, dead-bat defence from Elgar
pitched up and angling across off, ignored
back of a length on off, tucked away to deep midwicket
off-stump yorker, dug out to point
back of a length and outside off, Elgar jabs it away to deep point
very full and wide outside off, left alone
another wide one, ignored
length ball on middle, blocked back to Mehidy
starts on leg and breaks away, Elgar presses forward and smothers it
skidding into the pad as Elgar does not make contact with a flick. It pitched outside leg
shorter, flatter outside off, hit down to long-off off the back foot
full on off, blocked to short mid-on
tight line on off, defended to the off side
overpitched on off, Elgar skews a drive to mid-on off the inside half

Elgar gets forward and jabs a drive to mid-on
slightly overpitched and outside off, Elgar stretches out and laces a drive between cover and mid-off. Gorgeous
lifter outside off, Elgar lets it fly through to Liton
back of a length and outside off, guided to backward point
sliding into the pads, whipped away through backward square leg off the back foot
worked with the break through midwicket
clipped with the turn to short fine leg now
flatter and shorter outside off, punched to short mid-on
flighted on off stump, nurdled to square leg
full on middle from around the wicket, driven between the bowler and short mid-on
full on middle, pushed to mid-on
nice and full outside off, gets forward and drives it straight to mid-off
full-toss, angling away outside off, Markram throws his hands at the ball and flashes an outside edge between the keeper and first slip
overpitched and outside, and it's drilled straight to extra cover
back of a length and outside off, chopped to backward point
slower offcutter outside off, Markram runs a controlled edge and threads the cordon
length ball on middle and leg, blocked to midwicket off the back foot
full on middle, patted to the off side
floated on the leg stump, pushed down to long-on
starts outside off and breaks in, this length ball is blocked to the leg side
driven off the pads to deep midwicket
short and spins away outside off, flayed to wide long-off off the back foot
dangled up outside off, stroked to midwicket
pushed through on middle, flicked to midwicket
whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
pushed through and spins in, forced down to long-on
short and keeps low outside off, cracked away to the sweeper on the off side
tossed up outside off and breaks in at off, driven down to long-on
short of a length and angling away outside off from over the wicket, lashed away to sweeper cover
pitched up and outside off, driven off the front foot to the left of extra cover
good length on a set of stumps outside off, ignored
good length and wide outside off, steered off the face to a tumbling gully
clipped off the pads to the left of mid-on. Elgar passes Pujara to become the top scorer in Tests in 2017
rising short ball just outside off, cramps Markram for room. Fended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, spins in, clipped away to square leg off the back foot
half-tracker on off stump, begs on its knees to be smashed. Markram obliges. He ventures deep in the crease and pulls it away to the wide long-on boundary
slides on outside off from around the wicket, eased through the line to long-off
skidding into the thigh, deflected fine on the leg side
short dart outside off, flayed to deep cover

tossed up very full and spins in to beat Elgar on the sweep. Was it drifting past the leg stump? Not given. Mushfiqur challenges the on-field not-out decision. More out of hope rather than conviction.A bit too full for the sweep and turns in to catch the front pad. No snick involved. The tracker shows it would have missed the leg stump by a long way
Taskin is back on the field. Just short of a good length on off, turned to the right of mid-on
short on off from around the wicket, manipulated wide of midwicket with the wrists
back of a length and outside off, cracked to the cover-point sweeper, where Mustafiz fumbles. The result is an easy two
good length and angled down the leg side as Markram glances... and misses. Good take from Litton tumbling to his left
Markram fetches a short ball from outside off and short-arm flaps it away past the right of mid-on
hung up full and wide - wider than a set of stumps outside off - Elgar does not go chasing the ball
short dart outside off, square cut away for one
tossed full on middle, Elgar moves forward and clips the ball away to short midwicket
tossed up and angling in on middle, Elgar twinkles down the track, unleashes the smoothest of bat-swings and sends the ball over the wide long-on boundary. He fetches his second six of the innings
dangled up full and wide outside off, driven through the line to cover
fired outside off, driven to short cover, the fielder falls to his right to intercept the ball
short offbreak outside off, stroked to deep cover off the back foot. He moves to 99
flighted outside off, Elgar goes low and pings a slog sweep to midwicket

No hundred on Test debut (at least in the first innings) for Markram. A horrible mix-up between the wickets. Elgar sinks to his knees. Markram is distraught. Mehidy pumps his fist and the Bangladesh fans celebrate in the stands. Tossed up just a shade outside off, Elgar opens the face and dabs it to the left of backward point. He takes a few paces down the pitch and calls for a run. Markram responds, and is nearly halfway down the pitch before turning back to undo his steps. Mominul swoops down on the ball and throws it to Mehidy who whips the bails off. The debutant is caught well short. Anticlimactic end to a solid, solid innings
full on middle, forward and driven firmly back to the bowler

tossed up outside off, Elgar dances down the track, aims to loft. Instead slices it straight of mid-on. He raises his fourth Test ton this year and ninth overall. Subdued celebrations. Bitter-sweet moment for Elgar
on a length and turns away outside off, dabbed more or less straight to backward point
floated up on off stump, Elgar presses forward and smothers it

good length on off, Amla blocks off the front foot
really full and outside off, Amla deploys a bigger stride and pushes the ball to cover
length ball on off, Amla opens the face and carefully dabs it to point
pitched up and outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
floaty full ball outside off, driven to extra cover off the front foot

worked with the break to square leg
flighted higher on off stump, smothered off the front foot
skidding into the pads, worked away past the left of midwicket
tossed up on off stump, Amla is solid in defence
back of a length and outside off, chopped behind to the cordon
pretty full and rolls through outside off, no shot
another full ball bounces twice on its way to the keeper as Elgar ignores it

back of a length and outside off, Amla punches it with the wrists to long-on
back of a length on off stump, firmly whipped away to deep midwicket
darted in on the pads, easily picked off to deep square leg
worked with the break to backward square leg

Amla sashays down the track and drives a full ball with the turn to mid-on
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
tossed up on off, defended solidly
full and angling away outside off, front-foot drive to mid-off
length and outside off, punched to mid-off
short of a length and outside off, Amla stands tall and punches it handsomely straight of mid-off. Gloriously played with a high elbow
full and angling away outside off, left alone
full and angling away outside off, left alone

full cutter outside off, draws Amla into a loose waft outside off and beats the outside edge. Grazes the back pad and settles into the gloves of the keeper. Not given. Mushfiqur decides against a review. Coming to the lbw: the ball pitched outside leg and snaked away
sliding on outside off, tapped to point
Elgar opens the face and dabs a full ball from outside off to point
speared full on of, jammed out to cover
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-on
flighted and outside off, driven to the left of short cover

slides on outside off, played back to the bowler
full on the pads, Elgar presses forward and drives it in the gap between midwicket and mid-on for three
back of a length and outside off, left alone
similar line and length, Elgar plays at this and guides it to backward point
full and angling in, tight leave. It wasn't far away from the off stump
back of a length on off, whipped into the leg side
dug short and outside off, Bavuma rolls his wrists and controls a pull to long leg
pitched up and on off, driven back to Taskin
shorter and outside off, dabbed to the cordon with soft hands
pitched up and sliding away with the angle outside off, Bavuma covers his off stump and lets it go
full on off, driven to cover off the front foot
full and angling away outside off, Bavuma gets forward, meets the pitch, and caresses it to sweeper cover
on a length and holds its line outside off, glided through cover-point
slower offcutter, bites into the surface, dabbed to midwicket
round-arm short ball on off, swatted to midwicket
tossed-up offbreak outside off, Elgar runs down the track and looks to clout it over the leg side against the break and across the line. He thickly edges it through vacant cordon
length-ball offbreak, defended on off stump
dangled up on off stump, Bavuma stretches out and sweeps it along the ground to square leg
dangled up on middle now, worked to midwicket
Mehidy finds sharp turn, breaking down the leg side, beating Bavuma's sweep
Mustafiz bangs a bouncer outside off, Elgar, who is on 199, ducks out of the way

Elgar has been dismissed for 199, and Markram in the dressing room has his hands on his head. Another anticlimactic end to another sparkling innings. Mustafiz bangs it short and outside off again. Replays suggest he had rolled his fingers across this one. Elgar can't get on top of the bounce. That's a weak pull that lobs to midwicket. Elgar was actually caught between pulling and leaving. He does not bit of both and sends a top edge to Mominul
that's a sensational shot to start off. Gets a harmless half-volley outside off and du Plessis meets it with a good forward stride and leans into the drive through long-off

that's another horrific delivery. Two dollies first-up to the new batsman. This one's back of a length and down the leg side as Mustafizur overcompensates with line and length, Du Plessis glances it fine
much better. Still slightly leg sidish but closer to the middle and leg line this time, du Plessis blocks with a straight bat
fullish length ball on middle and leg, du Plessis puts his head down and defends solidly
loopy tossed up ball around off, defended
curves in on middle and off and spins in, Bavuma helps it with the spin into the leg side for one
flat length ball, drifting down leg, tucked fine.Wants a third but Bavuma sends him back and rightly so
full, flat and outside off, du Plessis keeps it out
fullish on off, nudged towards a straightish midwicket for one
full and spinning in around middle and off, defended
short of a length, angled across outside the off stump of the right-hander, du Plessis stands tall and punches into the covers
full, closer to off this time at 124.3 ks, du Plessis defends late with an open face
short of good length, much quicker at 134 kmph this time, du Plessis susses out the angle and shuffles across before shouldering arms
full, more than a set of stumps outside off, du Plessis reaches out and pushes it in front of mid-off, just to his left, and Mushfiqur makes a good, diving save
short and wide, cracked off the backfoot but just to the right of point who gets down to his right in a flash. Mehedi the man
fullish length ball, pitches outside leg, Bavuma watchfully drops it into the off side off the front foot
fullish length ball, spinning in towards off, stays back and blocks
turns a mile from outside off. No shot played by du Plessis but he had shuffled across and the impact seemed to be outside off
indecision against this fuller ball. Gets down to sweep but it's too full and he is forced to defend it late and clumsily. Loses balance
full, reaches out and drives it out into the off side
tucked towards midwicket for a single
shot. In his swinging arc and Bavuma capitalises with a free swing of the arms. Gets the room he wants outside off and full enough for him to get on top of it. Launched over long-on
full on off and du Plessis walks into the front foot drive. Caresses it straight back with the straightest of bats
short ball. du Plessis swivels with the pull but the ball hits the helmet off the edge of the bat. No pace, so he swing slightly early. Gets away to third man
short ball, pitches down the leg side and du Plessis lets it go
length ball, angled across on off, defended
bends forward and pushes this fuller ball into the covers region
full toss, slips out of the hand and comes on around off, doesn't manage to get into a great position as he punches into the off side
length ball, punched from the crease into the on side
good length, spinning in on middle and off, defended with a straight bat
plants the front foot across and sweeps this fuller ball just behind square on the leg side
full, outside off, strides across and bunts it out
shuffles across to this length ball and lets it hit the back pad as he is well outside off
front-foot defense into the off side
full and straight, holding its line outside off, left alone
similar delivery, Bavuma takes a long stride across and offers no shot
full toss outside off, driven out to sweeper cover
full, straight, tails away late, left alone
back of a length, keeps a little low outside off and du Plessis chops the backfoot punch into the ground
walks across to this length ball and opens the bat face late to dab it down to gully
length ball, spinning in on off, worked to the left of the bowler
shifts back to this length ball and tucks it away to square leg
full and spinning in, Bavuma walks across and brings the bat out and the ball takes the inside part of the bat, brushes the pad and goes behind square
defended off the front foot into the off side
short of a length, rocks back and pulls with authority through midwicket
length ball, minimal turn outside off, defended from the crease
fullish length, straightens late in the channel outside off, left alone
this time it holds its line, another fullish length delivery, left alone by du Plessis
length, angling in towards off, defended from the crease
back of a length delivery outside off, punched firmly off the backfoot to the covers
short of good length, outside off, punched to mid-off
fuller ball, outside off, comes forward and pushes it through the covers for one
length ball, punched off the backfoot to midwicket
full, comes forward and eases it down to long-on
huge shout for leg before. More optimistic than anything. Length ball that spins in and beats the inside edge and pings the pad. Impact outside off
swept straight to square leg
loopy non-turning off-break outside off, slashes it to point
brings down a straight bat to this length ball and it takes the inside part of his bat to the leg side
length ball, holding its line outside off, left alone
short and wide, under-edges the cut to the cordon. Went too hard at it and lost shape
fullish length ball outside off, lets it come on and opens the face to point
goes too hard again, this time at a pull shot. Has to fetch it from outside off. And besides, it keeps slightly low. All that means all he can manage is an inside edge into the back thigh
very full, fires it wide of off in the first place and it drifts away prodigiously late to go outside the popping crease
full, outside off, meets the pitch and crunches a drive just wide of sweeper cover. The call is for two early and they complete it easily in the end
length ball outside off, drops it in front of covers and takes off for a single but is sent back by du Plessis. No crisis in the end
full, outside off, meets it with a stride across and gets down to sweep to square leg
length ball, tucked into square leg
full and straight outside off, easy stride forward and push into the covers for a quick single
slight turn into the off stump. Bavuma nudges it into the leg side
full, straight on off, defended
loopy flighted fuller ball, pushed down to long-on
back of a length, hint of movement into him, defended off the backfoot
full, slight movement outside off, left alone
length ball, outside off, cracked off the backfoot to point
short and wide, slapped off the backfoot through backward point
length, holding its line outside off, Bavuma shoulders arms
full, angled in at middle, nudged through midwicket for one
non-turning length ball on off, punched back
back of a length, waits for it to do its thing before punching with the turn to long-on
pacy fullish ball - 88.9 ks outside off, kept out
fuller, well outside off again, defended
full on off, swept hard but straight to square leg
back of a length, no turn, punched from outside off towards midwicket
short of good length on off, shifts back and punches down the ground
short of a length, angled in at off, defended back off the inside part of the bat
short ball, fetches a pull from outside off to deep midwicket
length ball, pushed across the off-stump of the right-hander, left alone
full and pushed across, entices the batsman to drive and du Plessis goes after it to get beaten
fullish length, pitches on middle and leg and angled across, played watchfully into the off side
pitched up around off, blocked
full, outside off, defended into the covers
non-turning legbreak on middle, Bavuma shifts back and whips it to midwicket
short of a length, minimal turn after landing around off, punched to extra cover
short of a length again, slides in on leg and Bavuma comfortably keeps it out off the backfoot
angles in a fullish ball at middle and leg, flicked to midwicket

what a delivery! That's a brute from Morkel. De Kock goes up immediately but the umpire is unmoved. They do not opt to review and that's the right call. Back of a length, cuts into Liton who gets beaten on the inside edge. The ball brushed the back pad on its way to the keeper. Could have very nearly clipped the bails on its way
short ball from Morkel, Liton is pushed back hurriedly as he arches out of the line and lets it go
short of good length, pitches outside leg and comes on at waist height, nudged into the leg side from the crease
short of a length and angled across, shuffles across to get behind the line and bunts it out calmly
full, on the pads, flicked away through midwicket
length ball, angled across, left alone in the channel outside off
length ball down the leg side, Kayes tries to flick and misses
good length, closes the face tentatively and ekes out an inside edge to fine leg
short of a length, walks across and tries to flick and misses
back of a length, hits the glove of Kayes who keeps it out down the pitch
short of a length, holding its line outside off, Liton keeps his bat inside the line
full, angling in on the pads, flicked away through midwicket, past forward short leg. The ball rolls away to the boundary and deep square leg covers a decent distance to his left to pick it up
length ball, angled across, left alone
pushed a long way across and it drifts away further to go well out of the reach of the batsman
stifled appeal from South Africa. Scrambled-seam short ball, pitches around leg and Kayes tries to flick but the ball gets up to hit his hip and settles into the hands of short leg
flicked to backward square leg
fuller, angled across at the stumps, Imrul puts his head down and defends down the pitch
walks across to this fuller ball and attempts a flick but the ball goes down the leg side
full, comes on around off, bends forward and eases it into the covers
short of a length, tries to walk across and flick but the ball hits the thigh before going towards backward square leg
fullish on middle and leg, pushed back
length ball,tight lines on middle, defended off the inside part of the bat into the midwicket region
short of good length, shapes away slightly outside off and takes the outside edge as Imrul jumps back to deal with the bounce, away to square third man, between the cordon and gully
length ball, comes on straight, left alone in the channel outside off
nudges it into the leg side with the inward angle
short ball, angles in from outside off, arches back and lets it go
length ball, punched down with a straight bat
comes forward to meet the pitch and finds the inside part of the bat as the ball gets into the leg side
full, prodigious swing away from the left-hander from middle and leg, drifts away enough to be left well alone
full on middle and leg, angled across, gently leans into a push-drive between mid-on and mid-off
full on middle and leg, Kayes defends with a straight bat

short ball does him in. South Africa have been fairly clear that this is how they are going to go against the Bangladesh openers. It's a sound strategy when the ball is hard and new. Short ball, banged in halfway down and forces Kayes back. He fails to get on top of it as the bounce is too steep. Gets a glove to second slip as he arches back and tries to keep it down
fuller ball on leg, clipped into midwicket
length ball, angled across the left-hander, left alone
full on off, defended with a closed bat towards mid-on
short, well outside off and left alone
fullish length, outside off, defended
full on middle and leg, flicked off the pads through the legs of forward short leg
back of a length on off, the bottom hand comes off as he defends from the crease
short ball, stifling the batsman by firing it so close to him, Liton has to hurriedly arch his back and drop his wrists to get out of the line
length ball outside off, drops it in front of the mid-off region for a sharp single
full, outside off, driven to extra cover

short of a length, angling in towards off, Liton drops it into the covers and charges for a single. Bavuma sprints at the speed of light, gets down to his right, and fires a throw at the non-striker's end. Liton may have just made it even if it was a direct throw
short ball, jumps back to ride the bounce and keeps it out
full, outside off, gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, gets on top of it and keeps it out
back of a length, chops the punch with a half-angled bat to covers
length ball, angling in towards off, pushed down the ground, to the right of mid-off for a quick brace
short, wide, slapped off the backfoot through backward point. Two fielders give it a chase and one of them dives forward to flick it back to the other
short ball, this time the bounce isn't disconcerting and Liton can easily pull it through deep backward square leg. Rolls the wrists to keep it along the ground all the way. Brilliant control

another short ball, Liton pulls again but this time he isn't in as much control. Gets a top-edge on that, a healthy one, but the ball goes through the vacant spaces behind the square leg umpire, on the bounce and over the ropes
short ball, jumps back and drops it into the surface in front of off
full, outside off, drilled back
length ball outside off, pushes back and defends into the covers
short ball, jumps back and defends
good length outside off, gets close to the pitch with a long stride forward and blocks it solidly
full, outside off, drilled back to Rabada
short ball, goes through with the pull early - sort of a lazy attempt - and gets beaten
fullish, outside off, defended

outside edge, taken by Amla at first slip. Liton pays the price for reaching out for a delivery that is well outside his line. Should have really left that alone. Gets half-forward to a fuller length ball and gets a healthy edge that Amla takes easily
not quite, at least not first up. Just a fuller ball that is clipped off the toes through midwicket
length ball, just straightens enough to kiss the outside part of Rahim's bat as he looks to defend from the confines of his crease
short and wide, slapped off the backfoot through point who gets down to his left. But Rahim has timed that well and it races past him. Also a bit too far for the fielder to reach
length ball, holds its line outside off, Mushfiqur lets it go
short of a length, comes on below his waist and Mominul helps it on its way, just rolls his wrists and pats it away through backward square leg
back of a length, pitches outside leg and comes on around off, defended back from the crease
similar line and length, defended from the crease back to the bowler
good length ball, tries to entice the batsman by angling it across just enough to still keep it within his reach. Mominul is equal to the task and shoulders arms
length ball on off, defended to covers
short ball, swivels around and pulls off the backfoot through deep midwicket. Normal bounce and too easy
short of a length on off, defended to cover off the backfoot
short of a length, angled in and holding its line, Rahim trusts the bounce on that one and lets it go from close to off
good length, bang on off this time, punched solidly off the front foot
back of a length, left alone in the channel outside off
length, angling in on off, kept out into the covers
fullish outside off, gets a neat stride forward and bunts it out
nicely looped up outside off, Mominul drills it to midwicket off the inside part of the bat
length ball, shifts back and lets it spin in before helping it away to square leg
full and on the stumps, clipped away to midwicket
back of a length, spins away quite a bit, Rahim chops it into the surface as he pokes away from the body
full and on the stumps, defended back
length ball, Rahim presses forward to defend and the ball straightens to find the outside part of his bat
full on middle and leg, clipped from front of the pads to midwicket
full, pushed across a long way and left well alone
pushed a long way across again, not going to make the batsman play with that much drift
length, too wide again and Mominul doesn't bother going after it
short of a length, angled across, left alone
short of a length, holds its line around off, stands tall and whips it to square leg

dropped. That was a dream delivery from the left-arm spinner but Elgar puts down a straightforward catch. Length ball, spinning away, Mushfiqur closes the face against the turn and pops a healthy edge that pops out of Elgar's hand and hits the chin
front-foot defence
loopy fuller ball outside off, driven away through the covers
full outside off, defended
slider on middle and leg, doesn't turn, goes in front of square on the leg side off the inside part of the bat
angles in late from outside off, left alone
short of a length, defended off the backfoot
back of a length outside off, shuffles across and keeps it out on the off side
full, clipped off the toes to mid-on
short and wide, slapped off the backfoot through cover. Bang off the middle
full and angled in at middle and leg, driven out to mid-on
full, outside off, driven away through covers. Amla chases it down and flicks it back

another outside edge that has been dropped by Elgar. Straightforward chance again. Spins away off a length just enough to find the outside edge of Rahim. It grazed the glove of de Kock and that may have upset Elgar's judgement
drilled past short leg off the inside part of the bat
full, driven to covers
gets down for a reverse sweep and comfortably pats it away to deep backward point
full, outside off, Mushfiqur comes forward a bit too far in his bid to get behind the line and as a result gets the inside part of the bat as the ball goes to mid-on
full and on the pads, clipped away to deep fine leg. Too easy
short of a length, holding its line outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling in late but it was fired from wider so Rahim is confident that he has his offstump protected and shoulders arms
short of good length, Rahim tries to tuck it away and pops it in the air but well in front of the keeper
fuller, driven to mid-off
full, clipped away to midwicket
defended off the front foot
keeps his bat inside the line after getting across to meet the pitch
slightly short, waits for it and dabs it away through the backward point region
length ball, spinning in, tucked into the on side
short ball, Rahim hammers a pull through deep midwicket. Gets it past a straightish midwicket with ample power and placement
full and angling in on middle and leg, nudged away to mid-on
short of a length, opens the face of his bat and punches it down to deep point
fullish length, angling in, defended
shot. That's pristine. Comes neatly forward and throws all his weight behind this drive through the covers. Sweeper cover runs to his right and makes a good stop at the deep extra cover boundary
length ball, shifts back and nudges it to short leg
defended off the front foot
fullish length, defended off the outside part of the bat as it spins away
back of a length, defended off the backfoot to covers
defended off the front foot, chops it into the surface

that's a flat six. Came out of nowhere. Pitched and enough room to swing freely. Gets down on one knee and dispatches it over deep midwicket. Barely got any elevation, so it was hardly noticeable that the ball carried all the way
fuller ball, on middle and leg, clipped away off the pads through wide of mid-on. Scrambled-seam delivery, so comes on at a gentle pace
fullish length, angled across outside off, Mominul shoulders arms

is that a drop? Did it carry? Nope, well short of midwicket. Fuller ball, Mominul flicks and the ball stays in the air momentarily but bounces well in front before getting past the fielder at midwicket diving to his right
short of a length, angling away, defended back down the pitch
short of good length, angled across, left alone
back of a length, angled across on off, defended
slider, comes on full at leg stump, pushed out towards mid-on
full on the stumps, defended down the pitch
pitched up on middle and off, pushed into the off side
length ball, spins away outside off, shifts back and opens his face towards point
full and flighted on middle, driven out to mid-off
sliding on leg, nudged into the leg side
short of a length, gets on top of the bounce and pats it to point
full on off, flicked towards midwicket
short of a length, covers off-stump and defends to cover
full on off, drilled down to mid-on
full, wide, swings away from the body and gets beaten. Loose shot
full on off, defended to mid-on

Maharaj had Rahim dropped twice off his bowling but he still finds a way past the Bangladesh captain. Bat-pad does it finally. This is the opposite of what happened during those drops. That one spun away; this one drifts in to get the inside edge to the back pad. Rahim was playing for the turn. Forward short leg snaffles it
full, slides in, Tamim pushes it back to Maharaj off the inside part of the bat
walks forward and closes the face of his bat. Gets an inside edge to the pad and pops in the air but wide of first slip
full, outside off, Tamim blocks off the front foot
length ball, sliding in, tucked to forward short leg
pitched up outside off, defended on the front foot
veering into the pads, Tamim simply tickles it fine on the leg side and fetches his first boundary
back of a length and slanting in just a shade outside off, Tamim shows good judgement and tucks his bat inside the line
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Tamim tucks his bat inside the line and lets another one go in the corridor
short of a length and angling in on middle, Tamim gets on top of the bounce and punchily blocks to mid-on
on a length and closer to off, Tamim moves forward and slides it to point with an open face
good length and angling in on off, Tamim answers with a front-foot defence
Mominul dances down the track and drives a full-toss firmly to short extra cover, where Amla makes a tumbling save to his left
tossed up outside off, breaks back in to beat the inside edge as the batsman plays down the wrong line. Impact outside the line
sharp turn but the direction is down leg. Tamim does not make contact with a sweep
paddled from outside off wide of square leg
pitched up outside off, Maharaj lands it on the rough and gets it to break in. Mominul gets forward and smothers it
Mominul uses his feet and flicks a full ball with the turn to midwicket
good length and slanted in outside off, Tamim lets it go, dragging his bat inside the line
back of a length and angling in on middle, Tamim camps back and pushes the ball down to mid-on
good length and largely holds its line outside off, no shot from Tamim
on a length and outside off, Tamim presses forward, takes it on the up and drives the ball to the right of mid-off
back of a length and angling in on off, Mominul hangs back and flicks it to the left of midwicket. Markram throws himself to his left and intercepts the ball
full and outside off, prodded into the covers
tossed up and spins in around off, Tamim stretches out and blocks to the leg side
speared into the pads, back of a length, punched off the back foot to short midwicket
hung up outside the line of off, no turn, dead batted
floated up outside off, another dead-bat defence from Tamim
quicker and spins in on off, played back to the bowler
slower through the air, full on off, Tamim blocks off the front foot and rounds out the over
dug short and down the leg side as Mominul sneaks inside the line
proper bouncer on middle, better direction, Mominul sinks under it
off-stump full-toss, whipped to the left of short midwicket, who dives and takes some pace off the ball
half-volley on the pads, very friendly delivery, Tamim stretches out and flicks it through square leg with ease
on a length and outside off, run away to point
rising short ball on off, Tamim rises with it and fends it off
sliding away outside off, Monimul blocks off the back foot
quicker through the air, nudged to short midwicket
looped up on a fourth-stump line, blocked to the left of Maharaj
full and outside off, Mominul's spike gets stuck in the crease but he keeps it out
floated up outside off, blocked off the front foot
Maharaj tosses it on the rough outside off, and gets it to break in on middle, the batsman reads the spin and defends off the back foot. Another maiden from Maharaj
short and outside off, Tamim opens the face and pats it to the off side
banged short and outside off, ignored
short and slanted in on middle, Tamim throws his bat in front of his face and fends it off
too full on the leg stump, picked off to deep square leg
bouncer, bursts off the track outside off, Mominul sways away and drops his gloves
dug in short down the leg side, Mominul evades it
dangled up really wide outside off, Tamim swishes at a drive and watches an outside edge fly off the rough to third man
Maharaj gives it a good rip and finds turn from outside off, driven with the break to mid-on
Tamim presses forward and smothers this full ball on off stump
flighted on off stump, Tamim moves forward and plays it back to the bowler
shorter and speared outside off, defended to short leg

Tamim closes the day with a mighty six! Tossed up higher on middle, Tamim dashes down the track and meets the pitch of the ball. He unleashes the smoothest of bat-swings and sends the ball flying over the long-on boundary. Last ball of the day? Tamim doesn't care. Bam
Morne ventures wide of the crease, this length ball holds its line outside off. Mominul leaves it be
dug in shorter and closer to off stump, Mominul is right behind the line
good length and angling in on off from wide of the crease, played back down the pitch
short of a length and outside off as Morne runs in hard and hits the pitch harder. Mominul negotiates it well enough, opening the face and dabbing it to point with soft hands
good length on a fifth-sixth stump line outside off, Mominul lets it go
back of a length and wobbles away late outside off. The movement was after it had passed the batsman, who had nothing to do with it
back of a length and slanted in outside off, 138.2ks, Tamim tucks his bat inside the line
good length and outside off, Tamim dares to hit it on the up. He stretches forward and drives it strongly to the left of Bavuma at backward point. Shot
fuller and darts back in on off stump, Tamim presses forward and defends. Reverse?
overpitched and outside off, Tamim leans into another drive. He can only toe-end this to cover
back of a length and angling in on top of off stump, Tamim defends stoutly
pitched up and slanting in on off, 143ks, Tamim plays down the line and defends it back
full and outside off, no shot
back of a length and outside off, Mominul rides it to point
pitched up and outside off, encourages the drive. Mominul moves forward and eases it to cover
back of a length, angling in on middle, and curls away, Mominul aims to work it to the leg side. Skews a leading edge in front of cover
good length and angling back in, but does not threaten off, no shot
back of a length on middle, Morne attacks the stumps, played back down the pitch to mid-on
good length and reverses in a touch on off, Tamim looks to drive on the up, and ends up inside-edging it onto the pad

full and nibbling in, catches Tamim on the shuffle. He falls over the flick, and the lbw appeal is shot down. This looks tight. Faf chooses to challenge the on-field not-out decision. Starts outside off, angling in, and tails it to rap the front pad below the knee-roll. Impact in line, no inside snick, but is that heading down leg from around the wicket? The tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump. This now means SA don't lose a review
good length and left alone in the corridor
back of a length and outside off, Tamim stands up tall and stabs it to point
dug in short on off, 137ks, Tamim pats it down
full and outside off, run away to point off the face. Probing over from KG
just short of a good length and aiming for the top of off, Mominul stops it in its tracks
jumps from a length outside off, Mominul judges it well and lets it go
short and angling in on off, turned away to midwicket
good length and skidding in at off, Mominul has an uncertain jab at it and toe-ends it to the leg side
banged in shorter on off, Mominul gets on on his tippy toes and fends it off
whipped with the wrists from off stump to midwicket

Rabada unleashes a ripping reverse-swinging yorker, which floors Tamim. Nearly 143ks. It swerved in so very late late. Big appeal for lbw. Not given by Oxenford. Faf goes for another review. Was it pad first? Ultra Edge suggess the ball socked the boot first before bouncing into the bat as Tamim jammed it to the leg side. Pitching in line, impact in line, but Hawkeye suggests it was tailing down leg from around the wicket. It would have missed another stump down leg. Rabada can't believe it It was a genuine wicket-taking delivery, though
good length and zipping through outside off, no shot

back of a length and swerving in to rap the thigh as Mominul plays all around it. Did he manage an inside edge there? Otherwise, impact was in line, and the ball would have carried onto hit leg stump. Yes, Ultra Edge detects an inside snick
back of a length and reverses outside off, nipping away, Mominul has a loose waft and is beaten

very full and reversing in sharply, 141ks, on off stump, Mominul somehow keeps it out. Or not. Replays suggest it was pad first. Pitching in line, impact in line, smashing halfway up to the leg stump again
bursts from a length outside off, Tamim quells it to the off side
good length and slid in just outside off, Tamim dangles his bat inside the line and lets it go
back of a length and angled down leg
full and nipping down the leg side, grazes the pad and goes to Qdk
good length and largely holds its line outside off, Tamim is happy to push his bat inside the line
full and outside off, Mominul eases it to point
back of a length and zipping through outside off, left alone
good length and holds its line just outside off, squeezed back down the pitch
back of a length and raps the splice. Played to mid-off
bouncer down leg
back of a length on off, punched back to the bowler, front-foot no ball
back of a length on middle, 137ks, defended
full on the stumps, Mominul keeps it out
good length and angling in outside off, Tamim pulls his bat inside the line
full and in the corridor, left alone
full and swerving in on middle, Tamim presses forward and pushes the ball to the leg side
length ball, climbs and slams into the splice as Tamim defends it back down the pitch
glanced off the pads to long leg. First runs off Morkel this morning
length and outside off, pushed down to mid-on
rare loose ball outside off. Half-volley, Tamim leans into a drive and sends the ball clattering through the covers
good length on off, Tamim presses forward, and pushes it to cover-point. The fielder throws the stumps down but they take a further two runs off the ricochet
too full and outside off, Mominul drives it through the line between cover and mid-off
full and angling in , left alone outside off
Mominul latches onto width outside off and creams it past Bavuma at backward point
Rabada overcorrects his line and slides down leg, Mominul simply tickles it fine on the leg side and fetches back-to-back boundaries
full and angling down leg, past Tamim's flick
back of a length and slanted into off, worked to the leg side
dug in short on off, Tamim throws his bat in front of his face and fends it down
bouncer on the leg stump, forces Tamim to duck under it
veering into the pads - wrong line - tickled away to the fine-leg boundary
Olivier angles another full ball down the leg side, brushes the pad and Qdk tumbles to his right to get some glove on the ball and slow it down
floated full and rolls through outside off, left alone
low full-toss wide outside off, Mominul presses out and carves the ball to cover

Maiden Test wicket for Andile Phehlukwayo. Whoa! De Kock throws himself to his right and pulls off an incredible one-handed catch. He anticipated quickly, moving to his right before dishing out the full-length dive. Pretty full and angling down the leg side, Tamim does not get enough bat on the glance. He tickles a catch down the leg side. That it was a catch was down to de Kock's acrobatic effort. Tamim has been dismissed at the stroke of drinks
pitched up and holds its line outside off, ignored
on a length and wider outside off, Mahmudullah's front foot does not meet the pitch of the ball. Jabbed away to cover
Mahmudullah now does not let his hands wander away from his body. Tightly blocked to cover
clipped off the pads to long leg as Oliver bowls too straight
very full and slanted down the leg side, beats the flick, and a tumbling de Kock can't gather the ball cleanly
banged in short but the direction is down leg, Mominul shuffles inside the line
full on off, check-driven to mid-on
banged in short on the leg stump, hip-high ball. Mominul swivels on the back foot, uses the angle, and finds the square-leg boundary
full and curling away outside off, poked to point off an outside edge
good length and angling in on middle, tapped to the right of mid-on for a risky single. There was a mix-up between the wickets, but Mominul made it
full and angling in on off, the bat face close on impact as Mominul skews the ball down to mid-on
full on the stumps, check-driven straight to mid-on
overpitched on middle, driven with the wrists to the left of mid-on. Good timing and placement to boot
Mominul presses forward, looks for another on drive, but this time he has to settle with an inside edge to midwicket
length ball on off, Mominul gets right behind the line in defence
Oliver draws an uppish drive from Mahmudullah, but that's in the gap. A bit too full and outside off, carved in the air betwen point and cover
full and outside off, Mahmudullah stretches out and cracks a drive to short cover
back of a length and wobbles away outside off, left alone
Olivier goes wide of the crease, back of a length and angling into a good-looking push to cover
Olivier draws another uppish drive from Mahmudullah. Much fuller and outside off, Mahmudullah is early into a drive and chips it in the air to the left of short cover
back of a length and outside off, punched away from the body to extra cover

Mominul drives it in the air to the right of mid-on and brings up a fifty - his 12th in Test cricket. Tossed outside off, Mominul does not allow the ball to turn. He forays down the track and pings it down the ground
overpitched and outside off, Mominul stretches out and times a drive to the left of deep point
floated up outside off, no real turn, forward and driven less firmly to the left of deep point now
looped up on the rough and breaks in, Monminul gets forward and smothers it
shorter outside off and turns in to strike the thigh pad as the batsman plays all around it
half-tracker on the off stump, Mominul lays into a pull... and socks short leg
good length and angling in on off, played back to Andile
good length and just a shade outside off, punched on the up to the straighter of the two short covers
fuller on off stump, driven off the front foot to mid-off
full and wider outside off, driven on the up to the squarer of the two short covers
on a length and outside off, Mahmudullah does not hold himself back. Thrashes an on-the-up drive to Amla at straight short cover
pitched up and outside off, driven off the front foot to the left of square short cover. There's a short mid-off in as well
length ball, starts outside off, breaks in, blocked off the back foot to short leg
spinning down the leg side, left alone
tossed up on off, pressed to short midwicket
Mominul steps down the track, Maharaj pulls his length back. Defended quietly to short midwicket's right
dangled up outside off, Mominul stretches out and sweeps the ball straight to square leg
straight ball outside off, Mominul searches for turn, ends up prodding an outside edge past slip
on a length and outside off, Mahmudullah angles it down to third man. No protection there
Mahmudullah continues to play his shots. Four fours in his 17. He forays down the track, takes a floaty length ball from outside off and belts it to the right of mid-on
good length and angling in at off stump, three short covers in place now. The batsman can't pick the gap
back of a length on off, blocked to one of the three men in the covers off the front foot
really full and angling into the legs, clipped away to midwicket
back of a length and keeps low outside off, Mahmudullah slashes away from the body and bottom-edges it behind to de Kock
looped up outside off, flicked with the turn to short midwicket
on a length and spins in on off, blocked back
glanced behind square for a quick single
tossed up and turns away outside off, pushed with the break to cover
short and straight, whipped away to deep square leg off the back foot
faster and fuller just outside off, driven through the line to long-off off the front foot
shortish and angling in on off, nearly 140ks, Mahmudullah sits back and squirts an inside edge to square leg
on a length, inducker, shoots low outside off and runs past the inside edge
back of a length and angling in, 143ks, played back to the bowler
Rabada whizzes past the outside edge now. On a length and straightens away outside off, Mahmudullah wafts and misses
on a length and outside off, steered away to backward point
hip-high short ball on middle, Mahmudullah swivels and pulls it nicely to long leg
tossed up and drifts in on off stump, played up to cover
dropped short and outside off, cut away to cover
very full and drifts in on middle, defended back
forced to short cover
tossed up and outside off, Mahmudullah hits against the break. He goes low and slams a slog-sweep to the midwicket boundary. High risk, high reward
fullish and outside off, driven off the front foot to the right of short cover
just short of a good length and angling in, tucked off the hips to square leg. Fifty stand off 64 balls
back of a length and outside off, Mominul stabs it to the right of cover
back of a length and rushes on off stump, Mominul covers up in defence
full and straight, Mominul moves forward and drives it to short midwicket

Faf goes for a one-handed catch. But he can't cling on. If he can't, nobody can. Back of a length and outside off, Mominul has a crack at it and sends a thick outside edge past the outstretched right hand of the SA captain at slip
good length on off, played back down the pitch to mid-on
on a length and outside off, blocked
tossed up on off, defended to the left of short cover
tossed up on middle, shuffles across and blocks to midwicket
Mahmudullah presses forward and drives through the line to extra cover

cries of 'catch it'. Dropped by the keeper. Tossed up, drifts in, turns away. Big deviation. Mahmudullah wafts and edges it. De Kock can't close his gloves around this sharp chance. Amla, diving forward from slip, can't catch the rebound either
dabbed to point with an open face
just short of a good length and outside off, Mominul plays away from the body and chops it behind to the keeper
full and wide outside off, 140ks, Mominul thrusts his hands out at a big drive and slices it away through backward point
good length and keeps low on off, Mominul jabs his bat down. The ball rolls behind, so Mominul kicks it away square on the off side with his boot
too straight in line, clipped away to square leg
back of a length and wobbles away outside off, Mominul pulls his bat inside the line
low full-toss, reverses in on off, clipped out to short midwicket
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
skidding into off stump, Mahmudullah plays back and defends
looped up and spins away outside off, Mahmudullah drives on the up and slices it on the bounce to backward point
straight ball on off, dead-bat defence
turn and bounce outside off, left alone
flighted on middle, Mahmudullah smothers it
length ball, well outside the reach of the batsman. Straightens a touch late and Mominul lets it go
full and wide outside off, makes Mominul reach out for a drive as he caresses it out to covers
short ball, banged in halfway down and angled towards leg stump, Mahmudullah clumsily gets out of the way. Well, not quite, wears it on the upper left arm
fullish length ball, holds its line, left alone in the channel outside off
shortish, angled in at good pace but drifts down the leg side and the batsman offers no shot
walks into the shot. Length ball, holds its line outside off and Mahmudullah fails to get behind the line entirely, the ball rips past the outside edge
full, outside off, clipped to midwicket
fullish length ball, worked to midwicket
similar line and length, tucked to the man at midwicket
advances down and drills it back to the bowler
comes down the track and eases this fuller ball to long-on
ever-so-slight turn outside off from the good length region, Mahmudullah gets a stride forward and lets it go
good length, straightens a touch off the fourth-stump channel, left alone
fuller ball outside off, gets half-forward and eases into a drive through extra cover. The fielder runs back and slides to pull it back
full, around the fourth or fifth-stump line, forward press and drive into the covers by Mahmudullah
full, slight shape away from well outside the off-stump of the right-hander, Mahmudullah shoulders arms

walks forward and closes the face of his bat for a flick against the line. Morkel's getting the ball to shape away and that makes this shot dangerous. Straightens extremely late and takes the outside edge of Mahmudullah before it runs away through the slip and gully gap
defended into the off side
pitched up outside off, meets the pitch and bunts it out
loopy fuller ball, outside off, front-foot defence back to the bowler

that's a bit of a soft dismissal. Huge blow for Bangladesh. Maharaj bowls a length ball and Mominul is caught between the front and back feet. Comes forward initially and then shifts back to turn it away into the leg side. To his horror, he watches the ball go straight into the hands of forward short leg where Markram takes an outstanding reflex catch
length ball, spins away on off, defended on the front foot back to the bowler
length ball, not much turn. Just straightens a tad and it's left alone outside off
slides in on off and turns away ever-so-slightly to find the outside part of Sabbir's bat
after getting it to nip away all this while, Morkel now gets one to cut back in late and Mahmudullah chops it into the surface but a safe distance away from the stumps
length ball, outside off, defended

huge shout for lbw Morkel is very confident but du Plessis isn't so much. Morkel manages to convince him to refer this upstairs. Short of a length ball, cuts back in sharply to beat the inside edge and hit him on the high part of the back pad. The ball lobbed to gully but there was no bat involved. And the appeal was anyway for lbw. Umpire's call
shortish, angled into him. Mahmudullah' head isn't still and he clumsily tries to fend it off and ends up getting hit on the glove
length ball on off, pushes it to mid-off and there's a bit of a yes-and-no on the single. Sabbir is sent back and the call ends up having come early enough
loopy full ball on off, defended off the front foot
good length, comes forward and lets it spin before defending it solidly to silly point
slides in slightly from a length and finds the inside part of the bat as Sabbir defends
back of a length, spins away and gets a bit of extra bounce, Sabbir adjusts well and drops it into the off side, past the silly point fielder
fullish length on off, gets forward and puts his head down to defend it easily
loopy full and sliding in towards middle and off, kept out. Maiden from Maharaj
bouncer, angled in and going down leg, ducked under
straightish length ball in the corridor of uncertainty, rips past the outside edge of Mahmudullah who pokes away from the body
scrambled-seam length ball, angled in on middle and leg, defended
short ball and well-played by Mahmudullah. Curves into him from wide of the crease and he arches back and drops the wrists while keeping his eyes on the ball all the while
length ball, comes in slightly and he defends off the inside part of the bat
good shape away but fired too wide off the batsman to make him play. Swings quite a bit and the movement is late as well making de Kock scamper down to his right
loopy full ball on off, skips down the track to meet the pitch and drills it down to long-off
charges down again, needs to be careful. Loses some shape as he goes for a big loft over the leg side. Skews it off the inside part of the bat and barely makes any connection
defended off the front foot
goes too hard as he tries to crack this one off the backfoot. Doesn't get close to it and chops it towards covers
loopy, pitching around off, comes forward and eases it into the off side
length ball on off, kept out off the front foot
short of a length, just outside off, shuffles across and jumps up to keep it down off the backfoot
fullish, angles into him and that's a tad too easy for Sabbir who whips it from off the pads through midwicket. Rolls his wrists nicely and maintains a lovely position
length ball outside off, slight shape away late, left well alone
full, bang on off, drilled straight back to the bowler who hurls it back towards the stumps
length ball, cuts into him and he defends from the crease
good length, slightly wider of off this time and he has to reach out a little, drills it off the inside part of the bat back to Morkel, who again flings the ball casually back towards the stumps
clean strike. Fuller ball, curves into him and slides in around middle and leg. Clears the front leg and powers it over long-on
length, spinning away, cut off the backfoot to point
pitched up on middle and leg, defended down the pitch
full, slides in on middle, driven out

short of a length, not much turn, just straightens after landing and Mahmudullah punches it firmly off the backfoot. Bavuma puts in a full-length dive at covers to prevent what should have been a boundary
defends into the off side from the crease
length ball, angles in from wide of the crease, still wide of the batsman and he pokes at it casually to get beaten
short of a length, jags in, turned away between midwicket and square leg
back of a length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and stabs it to point
short of a length on off, blocked
short of good length, just outside off, opens the face after riding the bounce to run it down towards the square third man region
short of good length, around the fifth-stump channel, gets behind the line and solidly defends
pitched up outside off and spinning away, defended off the outside part of the bat
fuller ball on off, driven to covers
full, outside off, leans into a drive to covers

excellent effort from Markram at short leg but can't get to the ball. Mahmudullah comes forward and defends with hard hands. The ball stays in the air momentarily and Markram flings himself forward, almost halfway towards the pitch but the ball drops just in front of him
now he defends with soft hands, to Markram at silly point again
a tad short and some width, opens up for a late cut to backward point
short of a length, holds its line outside off, keeps the bat inside the line
slightly fuller this time, on a length, well wide of off stump to keep the batsman uninterested

outside edge, runs down to square third man, past third slip. Angles in and straightens off a back of a length, Sabbir cautiously brings out a straight bat but can't get behind the line because of the late movement
length, around off, defended into the covers
fullish, prodigiously swings back in to find the inside edge and hit the back pad
back of a length, angled in on off from wide of the crease, defended
full, loopy and sliding on leg, defended
very full, almost a yorker on leg, dug out
